title: Tori Spelling and Drea de Matteo celebrate the launch of Belly Bandit's Belly Wrap
text:
It's a celebration these two just couldn't turn down.

Tori Spelling, 46, and The Sopranos' Drea de Matteo, 47, stepped out on Thursday to celebrate the launch of Belly Bandit's new postpartum Belly Wrap in Los Angeles.

The two women smiled as they posed for photos along with other guests such as Drea's daughter Alabama, Jazmyn Simon, and Angelique Cabral.

Having fun! Tori Spelling and Desperate Housewives' Drea de Matteo stepped out on Thursday to celebrate the launch of Belly Bandit's new postpartum Belly Wrap in Los Angeles

Mother daughter time! Drea and her daughter Alabama smile at the event together as they hang out and even get their portrait drawn

For the occasion, the 90210 alum and mother-to-five wore a tan dress with black polka dots.

The dress had a ruffled skirt and top and she wore a black belt to compliment the look.

She wore a pair of black high-heeled boots that went up to about her calf as she enjoyed the outdoor event.

Stylish: For the occasion, the 90210 alum and mother-to-five wore a tan dress with black polka dots

More rose please! The dress had a ruffled skirt and top and she wore a black belt to compliment the look

Drea and her 11-year-old daughter appeared to be having a blast at the event.

The Sopranos alum wore a simple blue t-shirt that she had tucked into her dark wash denim jeans that she paired with a multi-colored belt.

She wore a pair of tan boots and had on a pair of chic brown sunglasses while hanging out with her family and friends.

She's a cool mom! The Sopranos alum wore a simple blue t-shirt that she had tucked into her dark wash denim jeans that she paired with a multi-colored belt

Smile! The two girls sit still as an artist sketches their picture to capture the moment

In a recent interview, Tori's husband Dean McDermott opened up about what it's like to keep the spark alive in a decade-long marriage.

'You have to make it a priority to spend time together because you spend so much time focused on your kids, you forget about each other and each other's needs,' he said during an interview with People magazine.

He also gave some sound advice on how to keep your partner interested saying: 'Just grabbing your husband or your wife out of nowhere and just for no reason, and kissing the nape of her neck and saying, 'I love you so much, you're so beautiful.' Just being appreciated. Saying 'You're beautiful, you're handsome.' Just looking in their eyes.'
